UserStory.heading: SFX
UserStory.Description: As a player, I want the game to have Sound Effects when player operate game functions, so that I can have a better experience in terms of sound.
UserStory.DescriptionZH: 玩家操作游戏时有不同音效
UserStory.INVEST:
Independent: No, because the "SFX" feature is likely to depend on other features in the game, such as animations or events, to trigger the appropriate sound effects.
Negotiable: Yes, because the specifics of which sound effects to include and how they are implemented can be adjusted based on the team's resources and priorities.
Valuable: Yes, because sound effects can enhance the player's experience by providing feedback on actions or events, adding immersion to the game world, and creating a more polished game overall.
Estimable: No, because the level of effort required to implement the "SFX" feature is difficult to estimate without knowing the specific sounds required and how they are implemented.
Small: Yes, because the "SFX" feature can be a relatively isolated and self-contained feature within the game, especially if the team reuses existing sound assets and mechanics.
Testable: Yes, because the team can create test cases to ensure that the sound effects are playing as intended and enhancing the overall gameplay experience.

Tests.Test: To test for corresponding sounds when characters interact with objects, use an audio playback device.
test whether the corresponding sound is heard in the audio playback device when characters attack enemies, objects that can emit sound, and so on.

UserStory.Label: Must Have
